21 Matheu.
SEint Matheu þe Ewangelist &punctelev; apostel he was and is,[al. iwis]
Ewangelist and eke apostle &punctelev; forsoþe he was and is
Ewangelist, for he godspelles made &punctelev; þat men doth ofte rede
Apostel, for ore louerd here on vrþe &punctelev; seint Matheu with him gan lede
For ase ore louerd eode ouer lond &punctelev; seint Matheu he sai&yogh; bi cas
his mester don of walkingue &punctelev; for a follare[al. tollare] he was
Fals and trichor of is werk &punctelev; and liuede bi falshede
Ore louerd him hiet bileue is weork &punctelev; "cum siwe me," he seide
And he bilefde þo is weork &punctelev; and wiz ore louerd eode
And is false mester liet &punctelev; for he nadde þerto non neode
¶ Fair forebisne ore louerd &yogh;af &punctelev; alle sunfole men þo
&YOGH;wane he ane so sunfole Man &punctelev; het with him go
Seint Matheu is sunnes bette &punctelev; and tok to cristindom
And siwede ore louerd swiþe faste &punctelev; and is Apostel bicom.
Sethþe þo ore louerd was into &punctelev; heouene iwend
Þe Apostles weren þo wel wide in londe &punctelev; forto prechie, isend
Into þe londe of Ethiope &punctelev; seint Matheu sone &yogh;ede
to prechie men to cristinedom &punctelev; ase it was wel gret neode
¶ He founde tweie luþere men &punctelev; and strongue wichchene þere
Zaroen and Arphaxat &punctelev; þat þe deueles limes were
Þat, ase huy wolden, in grete siknesse &punctelev; manie men hadden ido
And manie men þoru&yogh; þe feonde &punctelev; ihelde huy hadden also
Alle þat þe luþere men &punctelev; in siknesse brou&yogh;te
Seint Matheu heom helde anon &punctelev; and wel clene heom out sou&yogh;te
Sorie weren þis luþere Men &punctelev; huy nusten &yogh;wat was to done
Tweie dragones, þat feondes weren &punctelev; to heom huy cleopeden sone
Þat casten brumston and fuyr &punctelev; and [slowe][om.] &yogh;end al þe londe
Mannes[r. men and] bestes þerewith wel þickeâ€” &punctelev; heom ne mi&yogh;hte no þing at|stonde
¶ Þis luþere men nomen þe dragones to heom &punctelev; for huy scholden to|drawe
Þane Apostel seint Matheu &punctelev; and bringue him of lijfdawe
Þo seint Matheu þis iheorde &punctelev; baldeliche he gan gon
Þe signe he made of þe croiz &punctelev; and to heom wende anon
Anon so þe dragones him isei&yogh;en &punctelev; to is fet huy fullen adoun
huy ne mi&yogh;hten heom wawien hider ne þuder &punctelev; ane fot for al þe toun
"lo, &yogh;e wrechches," quath þe apostle &punctelev; to þe luþere men tweie
"&YOGH;ware is nouþe al eouwere mi&yogh;hte? &punctelev; ouercome &yogh;e beothþ beine
¶ &YOGH;if inadde nouþe mine louerdes grace &punctelev; for eou &yogh;eorne bisou&yogh;t
On eovsulf it scholde nouþe bifalle &punctelev; ase &yogh;e hadden bi me iþou&yogh;t
Þis twei luþere dragones &punctelev; þat &yogh;e habbuth hidere ibrou&yogh;t
Arereth heom &yogh;if &yogh;e mowen &punctelev; oþur eower art nis nou&yogh;t."
¶ Euere stoden þis wrechche men &punctelev; ri&yogh;ht ase huy weren inome
huy weren of seint Matheu aferde sore &punctelev; and heolden heom ouercome
Seint Matheu þis tweie dragones &punctelev; þoru&yogh; Iesu cristes lore
Out of þe londe heom drof anon &punctelev; þat huy ne comen þere nonmore
he wende aboute and prechede &punctelev; and þe tweie schrewene liet go
Ouercomene wrechches ase hui weren &punctelev; nas heom neuer er so wo
¶ Hit bifeol þat þe kingues sone &punctelev; of þe londe was ded
Sone þis twei&yogh;e deoueles limes &punctelev; togadere nomen hore red
And wenden þudere, &yogh;if huy mi&yogh;hten &punctelev; þoru&yogh; heore art him[orig. heom] arere
And huy maden heore enchauntement &punctelev; ase þe deuel heom gan lere
Ake þat child lai euere dedâ€” &punctelev; for heore mi&yogh;hte nas ri&yogh;th nou&yogh;t
Þoru&yogh; þe kingue huy weren inome &punctelev; and in strongue prisone ibrou&yogh;t
¶ Þe king sende aftur seint Matheu &punctelev; ase men of him tolde
&YOGH;if he mi&yogh;hte is sone arereâ€” &punctelev; for he was so wis iholde
Þo seint Matheu þudere cam &punctelev; to ore louerd he[MS. heo] dude is bone
And arerde þat child &punctelev; fram deþe to liue wel sone
Þat child aros and herede god &punctelev; ibore of mayde marie
Anon so þe king þis isei&yogh; &punctelev; wel loude he gan to crie
"Forsoþe," he seide, "ich iseo &punctelev; þat Matheu a god is
Þei he beo here in mannes fourme &punctelev; he is a god, iwis
¶ Anoure we him ase it is ri&yogh;ht &punctelev; with seluer and with golde."
huy offreden to him tresor inou&yogh; &punctelev; more þane he afongue wolde
"Nai certes," quath þis holie man &punctelev; "god nam ich nou&yogh;t
Ake godes seriaunt þat here on eorþe &punctelev; to deþe was ibrou&yogh;t
hoso wole on him bilieue &punctelev; to heouene he schal iwiende
And hoso nele nou&yogh;t, he worth iwis &punctelev; in pine withþouten ende."
So þat þe king and alle his &punctelev; icristnede of him were
With þe tresor þat men him brou&yogh;te &punctelev; a fair churche he liet arere
¶ In þritti dawes heo was arerdâ€” &punctelev; so gret hel[p] þare was to
Þare þe king and is heore beden bede &punctelev; and alþe contrei&yogh;e also
Aftur þe tuei&yogh;e[MS. trei&yogh;e] enchauntours &punctelev; seint Matheu liet sende
Zaroes and Arphaxat &punctelev; and made heom þannes wiende
Into þe londe of perce &punctelev; huy wenden with schame inov
Þere þat folk misbileued &punctelev; wel þicke aboute heom drov
¶ Sethþe seint symon and seint Iude &punctelev; to perce þene wei nome
And þulke two enchauntours &punctelev; to grounde huy ouercome
Þare huy neuereft cristine Men &punctelev; non anuy ne wrou&yogh;te
Ase Man mai in heore liue iseo &punctelev; hoso þareafter sou&yogh;te.
Seint Matheu in Ethiope &punctelev; þe kingues dou&yogh;ter nam
Þat of hireseolf was a clene þing &punctelev; and &yogh;af hire cristinedom
A[r. and?] made hire auouwe chastete &punctelev; and clene lif to lede
þat maide was wel apaid euereafturward &punctelev; of þat ilke dede
¶ A king of an oþur londe &punctelev; is loue on hire he caste
And wolde ire habbe to his spouse &punctelev; and wowede hire wel faste
Þo þis maide nolde is wille do &punctelev; to seint Matheu he &yogh;eode
Þat he scholde in his half beo &punctelev; and bed him grete mede
¶ "Cum," quath seint Matheu, "þilke dai &punctelev; and ich hire wolle rede
Þat heo heolde hire spoushod &punctelev; and þareinne hire lijf lede."
Þe king was glad and wende wel &punctelev; Þat he bi him it seide
Þat he wolde hire to him redeâ€” &punctelev; ake he nolde nou&yogh;t don so to quede
Þe king cam aday, and muche folk &punctelev; with him he gan bringue
And þis maide cam also &punctelev; to hure seint Matheus prechingue
Seint Matheu stod and prechede &punctelev; þat folk al abrod
Mest he preisede of alle þingue &punctelev; in is sarmun spoushod
And þat þere nas no lijf so guod &punctelev; þare it was trewe and clene
Þe kyng was glad and hopede wel &punctelev; þat he it dude bi him mene
For þat Maide scholde &punctelev; to him iwedded beo
Seint Matheu he louede muche &punctelev; and hopede is wille iseo
¶ So þat sethþe seint Matheu &punctelev; is prechingue forþere drou&yogh;
And seide, "&yogh;if þe king hadde a wif &punctelev; þat he louede inou&yogh;
And a fol come in spousbruche &punctelev; and lei&yogh;e bi is wiue
Þe king wolde beo wroth inou&yogh; &punctelev; and bringue him of liue
For he him hadde is wijf binome &punctelev; and imad hire don amis
Of þe hei&yogh;e king of heouene &punctelev; also it fareth, iwis
&YOGH;if he hathþ a guod spouse &punctelev; þat ledeth clene lijf
And þare come forthþ a fol &punctelev; and binime him is wijf
To strongue deþe he wolde him bringue &punctelev; and to þe pine of helle also
Þarefore ech man beo iwar &punctelev; þat he swuch þing ne do."
¶ Þo þe kin[g] iheorde þis &punctelev; sone he onderstod
Þat it was ri&yogh;ht bi him iseid. &punctelev; for wrathþe he was nei&yogh;h wod
And swor þat he nolde bliþe beo &punctelev; are he were[MS. he were a were] awreke
For[th][MS. for] he wende and bigan anon &punctelev; seint Matheus dethþ bispeke
Þis guode man nas noþing aferd &punctelev; he prechede euere faste
And confortede þat clene maide &punctelev; þat ire heorte opon him al caste
¶ Þis Maide feol doun to is fet &punctelev; and on him &yogh;eorne gradde
Euere þis guode man hire bisou&yogh;te &punctelev; þat heo clene lijf ladde
Sethþe he wende and greiþede him &punctelev; is masse forto singue
luþere Men iredie weren &punctelev; isende þoru&yogh; þe kingue
Ri&yogh;ht ase he stod at is Masse &punctelev; on of heom forthþ wende
And smot him þoruout with a swerd &punctelev; and alle his gottes torende
For he smot him In atþe Rugge &punctelev; and atþe wombe out
Þo þe guode Man aslawe was &punctelev; þe schrewe was wel prout
¶ Þat folk þat cristine was &punctelev; wel þicke it cam anon
Þe kingues paleis forto brenne &punctelev; and to aquelle is men echon
Ake seint Matheus desciples &punctelev; forboden heom echone
Þat huy ne duden no such þing &punctelev; ake lieten god wurþe alone
huy wenden and nomen þis holie bodi &punctelev; and swiþe faire on eorþe it brou&yogh;te.
Þe king &yogh;uyt bi al is mi&yogh;te &punctelev; after þat maide &yogh;eorne sou&yogh;te
Ake þo he ne mi&yogh;hte in none manere &punctelev; to is wille hire iwinne
he wende forth and sette afuyre &punctelev; þat hous þat heo was inne
Ake seint Matheu ne for&yogh;at nou&yogh;t þat Maide &punctelev; þei he ded were :[orig. were ded]
Fram heouene he ali&yogh;hte adoun to hire &punctelev; and is help ire cudde þere[added]
For þat fuyr he drof a&yogh;ein &punctelev; to þe kingues paleis anon
And furbrende it alto nou&yogh;t &punctelev; and is Men echon
¶ Vnneþe he himsulf and is sone &punctelev; ascapeden with heore liue
he mi&yogh;hte segge, to wroþerhele &punctelev; he wilne[de] aftur wiue
For suyþe sone þareafturward &punctelev; Musel he bicam
And þo he ne mi&yogh;hte nou&yogh;t beo hol &punctelev; gret deol to him hee nam
With is swerd himsulf he aslou&yogh; &punctelev; and is bodi altorende
Nou god it wot and seint Matheu &punctelev; &yogh;wodere is soule wende
Þat folk wende forth anon &punctelev; and made ane newe king wel bliue
Þe clene maidenes broþur iwis &punctelev; þat he wilnede so muche to wiue
Þat seint Matheu þe apostel hadde &punctelev; icristned with is honde
&YOGH;wareþoru cristinedom &punctelev; cam sethþe into al þe londe
Nou Iesu crist us &yogh;iue is grace &punctelev; þulke Ioy&yogh;e iwinne
For þe loue of seint Matheu &punctelev; þat he woneth inne
